title: Spending On 2014 Campaign Ads On Track To Exceed $1 Billion
teaser: As the midterm elections approach, our media analyst John Carroll discusses the volume of campaign ads and who's behind them.
contentencoded:
Spending on political ads this election cycle is on track to exceed $1 billion, according to a new study by the Wesleyan Media Project. That translates into roughly two million ads in House, Senate and gubernatorial races.

But not all ad campaigns are created equal — especially in terms of bang for their buck. Here & Now’s media analyst John Carroll talks with host Robin Young about the volume of ads and who’s behind them.

Guest

  • John Carroll, Here & Now media analyst and professor of mass communications at Boston University. His blog is “Campaign Outsider” and he tweets @johncarroll_bu.
